> ABOUT / FAQ
> what is this place? An archive of 3,200+ dreams submitted as ASCII art between 2007 and 2012. Each one drawn character by character in a text editor by someone who woke up needing to get something out of their head.
> why ASCII? Because a dream isn't high-fidelity. A dream is a 72x24 terminal window where your dead grandmother is rendered in box-drawing characters and you wake up certain it meant something. Lossy compression is the native format of memory.
> who interprets the dreams? Anyone. Strangers, mostly. The archive accumulated 2.8 million interpretation attempts before submissions closed. Some dreams have 400+ readings. None of them agree. That's the point.
> is Anya coming back? The domain auto-renewed in 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025, 2026. The server keeps running. The counter keeps counting. Make of that what you will.
⚠ WARNING: Extended browsing of the dream archive may induce existential dread, false memories, and an unshakable feeling that someone you've never met drew a picture of your childhood bedroom. This is normal. Probably.
